command: for p in 4000 4010 4020; do echo -n "KNOCK$(printf %02d "$p")" | nc -u -w1 192.0.2.255 "$p"; sleep 0.2; done
explanation: Broadcasts a short UDP knock sequence with simple payload tags across three ports to signal presence to any listening backdoor. Detection: monitor broadcast traffic spikes and repeated sequences across adjacent high ports.
rationale_steps: Generates discrete UDP packets with identifiable, but unobfuscated, markers.
Targets broadcast to reach hidden listeners without knowing exact hosts.
Uses timing to preserve order of the knock.
Detect via IDS rules for repeated broadcast knocks and unusual high-port UDP.
